RiFo

That's the meat of their foreign policy. Condy seems to dislike routine work. Look what's going on in Iraq. That's real mess with no perspective of bettering things in the visible future. We owe this to America. 
 Now they are trying to act kind of mediators in Abkhazia and Georgia dispute. LOL Do we need one more Iraq in the region of vital EU interests? 
 Well, Americans have already held their "master class" in the region in Georgia! Saakashvili is Bush's pet and he's having American financial funding and all that. Still Georgia is lying in poverty and is being involved in drugs+arms traffic. There is widespread corruption there and some fishy links with terrorists. I've read in the web American diplomats and special services are no strangers to some of those things and ignoring lots of negative events in Georgia.
 Mind Georgia is positioning itself as part of Europe! It means European agencies should not just keep an eye on Georgia but delve into all the challenges she faces. We must be helpful and we are! 
 Relating America... Let'em rather make order in Iraq!!

 Well it has to be said that the economist published this report
daewoo

Well it has to be said that the economist published this report

 
 Very interesting piece. The autor did miss one importnat item and that is the fact that we changed the way we calculated productivity in the early 80's. It was apparent to Reagan that our crumbiling industrial infrastructure woudlno longer support providing numbers that would make the public happy,so he changed the way those numbers were calculated. It used to be that productivity had a work output component. Now it does not, it is strictly economic "output". What this means is that we can get away with calling marking up cheap foreign goods "productivity". 90% of the excess productivity since 2000 has been the result not of greater industrial or material output, but simply the result of marking up cheap foreign goods. 
 
 This also explains the gap and the crunch on the middle class. After all, how many people do you need, and how good do they have to be, to mark up chinese junk?
